title: Domestic Worker (Temporary) Executive visa (subclass 427)
raw_text: ===== main placeholder ========================================== ​This visa is closed to new applications. Domestic Worker (Temporary) Executive visa (subclass 427) Page Content ​The Domestic Worker (Temporary) Executive visa (subclass 427) is closed to new applications. You cannot apply for this visa. You can use the visa finder to search for an appropriate visa. Visa holders Details This information is for people who have already been granted a Domestic Worker (Temporary) Executive visa (subclass 427). It explains your rights and obligations. You can use Visa Entitlement Verification Online (VEVO) for free to check your visa details and entitlements. How long your visa lasts Details Your visa is usually valid for the period of the nominated position, with a maximum period of two years. What this visa lets you do Details This visa lets you: work in Australia as a domestic worker in the household of an executive who is the holder of a Business (Long Stay) visa (subclass 457) stay in Australia for the period of the nominated position, with a maximum stay of two years bring your family with you to Australia (they can work and study) leave and enter Australia as many times as you want while your visa is valid. Your obligations Details You and your family must: comply with all visa conditions and Australian laws. maintain an adequate level of health insurance while you are in Australia. Work in Australia Details You must: not stop working for the employer who sponsored you for this visa not engage in work or an activity that is inconsistent with your nominated position not stay in Australia after the permanent departure of your employer work only in the household of the employer who sponsored you for this visa. If you stop working for your sponsor Details If you stop working for your sponsor, you must: apply for a different visa leave Australia before your visa expires. Changing your sponsor Details You will not be able to change employers while you are on your current visa. If you want to continue to work as a domestic worker for an overseas executive while you are in Australia, you can use the visa finder to search for an appropriate visa. Your family’s obligations Details Your family cannot enter Australia before you. When your visa ends, your family must leave Australia with you. They must: intend to remain a member of your family unit maintain adequate health insurance while they are in Australia. Your family can work or study while their visa is valid. Tell us if things change Details Things you need to let us know about when you have this visa include: changes to your phone number, email, address or passport changes to your relationship status the birth of a child. See how to let us know if there is a change in your situation If you do not provide us with the details of any new passport issued to you, you could experience significant delays at the airport and may be denied permission to board your plane. Sponsors Details This information is for approved sponsors of people on a Domestic Worker (Temporary) Executive visa (subclass 427). You cannot apply to sponsor applicants for this visa because it is no longer open to new applications. You can use the visa finder to search for an appropriate visa. You can use Visa Entitlement Verification Online (VEVO for Organisations) to check the visa details and entitlements of a person that you have sponsored. How long the sponsorship lasts You can no longer use this sponsorship to sponsor domestic workers. Nominations Details Each occupation, program or activity which you nominated will have its approval cease on the earliest of: the day on which we receive written notification of your withdrawal of the nomination 12 months after the day on which the nomination is approved 3 months after the day on which your approval as a sponsor ceases if the nomination approval is given to you the day on which your approval as a sponsor is cancelled if the nomination approval is given to you the day on which the visa was granted on the basis of the nomination. Sponsor obligations Details You must be able to comply with following sponsorship obligations: cooperate with inspectors tell us when certain events occur keep records provide records and information to the Minister not recover from, transfer or charge certain costs to another person pay costs to locate and remove an unlawful non-citizen ensure the visa holder works in the nominated occupation, program or activity pay travel costs to enable sponsored people to leave Australia secure an offer of a reasonable standard of accommodation You are responsible for meeting all your obligations, even if you have someone else authorised to act on your behalf, including a migration agent. Cooperate with inspectors Details You must cooperate with inspectors appointed under the Migration Act 1958 (the Act) who are investigating whether: a sponsorship obligation is being, or has been, complied with you have hired an illegal worker there are other circumstances in which we could take administrative action. This obligation: starts on the day the sponsorship is approved or work agreement commences ends five years after the day the approved sponsorship ends or work agreement ceases. Cooperating with inspectors can include (but is not limited to): providing access to premises producing and providing documents within the requested timeframe not preventing or attempting to prevent ,access to a person who has custody of, or access to, a record or documents providing officers with access to interview any person on their premises. Keep records Details You must keep records that show you have your complied with your obligations. All records must be in a reproducible format and some must be capable of verification by an independent person. You must keep a record of: any notification that you were required to make to us the date on which you notified us, and how and where you made the notification. This obligation starts on the day the sponsorship is approved. This obligation ends two years after both of the following: you are no longer an approved sponsor, and you are no longer sponsoring anyone. You do not need to keep any records for more than five years. Provide records and information to the Minister Details You must provide records or information, if they are requested by a departmental officer that goes to determining whether: a sponsorship obligation is being or has been complied with, and determining whether other circumstances, in which the Minister may take administrative action, exist or have existed, in the manner and timeframe requested by the department. We may ask you in writing to provide records or information which relate to your sponsorship obligations, and any other matters that relate to your sponsorship of visa holders. You must provide the records or information requested if it is a record or information that: you are required to keep under Commonwealth, state or territory law you have an obligation to keep as a sponsor. This obligation starts to apply on the day the sponsorship is approved or work agreement commences. This obligation ends two years after: your sponsorship or work agreement ceases, and you no longer have a sponsored visa holder. Tell us when certain events occur Details You must tell us in writing when certain events occur. Send the information by registered post or electronic mail to a specified address and within certain timeframes of the event occurring. Events where a sponsor must provide information to us include: the cessation, or expected cessation of a primary sponsored person's employment. If an expected cessation does not take place or the primary sponsored person will cease employment on a different date than previously notified, you must notify us of the continued employment or new cessation date; and a change to the information in the sponsor's application for approval as a sponsor relating to the person's address and contact details. This obligation starts to apply on the day the standard business sponsorship is approved or the work agreement commences. This obligation ends two years after: your sponsorship or work agreement ends, and you are no longer sponsoring anyone. Where to send a notice of an event or change You must send details of these events by email or to one of our state or territory offices listed below. By email (preferred): sponsor.notifications@border.gov.au By registered post: Australian Capital Territory Sponsor Monitoring GPO Box 717 Canberra ACT 2601 New South Wales Sponsor Monitoring GPO Box 9984 Sydney NSW 2001 Queensland Sponsor Monitoring GPO Box 9984 Brisbane Qld 4001 Northern Territory Sponsor Monitoring GPO Box 864 Darwin NT 0801 South Australia Sponsor Monitoring GPO Box 2399 Adelaide SA 5001 Tasmania Sponsor Monitoring GPO Box 794 Hobart Tas. 7001 Victoria Sponsor Monitoring GPO Box 241 Melbourne Vic. 3001 Western Australia Sponsor Monitoring Locked Bag 7 Northbridge WA 6865 Ensure that the visa holder participates in the nominated occupation, program or activity Details You must ensure that the person you have sponsored participates only in the occupation, program or activity for which you nominated them. If you want to engage a visa holder for a different occupation, program or activity, you must lodge a new nomination application. This obligation starts on the day the person you have sponsored is granted a visa. If they already hold a visa when you nominate them, your obligation starts on the day the nomination is approved. This obligation ends on the day (whichever is the earliest): the sponsored visa holder has a nomination approved for another approved sponsor the sponsored visa holder is granted another substantive visa of a different type for which you sponsored them (unless that other visa is a bridging visa, criminal justice visa or enforcement visa the sponsored visa holder has left Australia and the relevant visa (and any subsequent bridging visa) is no longer in effect. Not recover, transfer or charge certain costs to another person Details You must not take any action or seek to take any action that would result in the transfer or charging of costs (including migration agent costs) to another person, such as a sponsored visa holder or their sponsored family members this includes costs that relate to: the recruitment of the person you sponsored becoming or being a sponsor or former approved sponsor. This obligation: starts on the day the sponsorship is approved or the work agreement commences ends on the following two events: you cease to be an approved sponsor or party to a work agreement you no longer have a sponsored visa holder. Sponsors are also required to pay certain costs associated with becoming a sponsor and not pass these costs, in any form, onto another person. These include: cost of sponsorship and nomination charges migration agent costs associated with the lodgement of sponsorship and nomination applications administrative costs and any sundry costs an employer incurs when they conduct recruitment exercises, including: recruitment agent fees migration agent fees the cost of job advertising screening of candidates, short listing, interviews and reference checks salaries of recruitment or human resource staff the cost of outsourcing background checks, police checks and psychological testing where they relate to an employer determining an applicant’s suitability for the position training of new staff responding to queries for prospective candidates, and advising unsuccessful applicants travel costs for the sponsor to interview and/or meet the applicant either overseas or in Australia. Pay travel costs to enable domestic workers to enter and leave Australia Details You must pay reasonable and necessary travel costs to enable the sponsored person and their sponsored family members to travel to and to leave Australia. The costs will be considered reasonable and necessary if they include all of the following: the sponsored person’s travel to Australia travel to the sponsored person’s place of residence in Australia from the place of arrival in Australia travel from the sponsored person’s place of residence in Australia to the place of departure from Australia travel from Australia to the country from which the sponsored person came to Australia are for economy class air travel or, where unavailable, a reasonable equivalent. This obligation starts on the day: the visa is granted (if the person does not already hold a 427 visa or 401 visa in the domestic worker (executive stream)), or your nomination is approved. This obligation ends on the day (whichever is the earliest): another sponsor has their nomination application for the same person approved the person you have sponsored is granted a further substantive visa of a different subclass to the one they last held the person you have sponsored has left Australia and the relevant visa (and any subsequent bridging visa) is no longer in effect. Pay costs to locate and remove an unlawful non-citizen Details In the event a primary sponsored person (or any of their sponsored family members) becomes an unlawful non-citizen, you may be required to pay the costs incurred by the Commonwealth in locating and/or removing the primary or secondary sponsored persons from Australia. You may be liable to pay the Commonwealth the difference between the actual costs incurred by the Commonwealth (up to a maximum of AUD10 000) less any amount which may have already been paid under the obligation to pay travel costs to enable sponsored persons to leave Australia (see ‘Obligation to pay travel costs’ above). This obligation starts on the day the person you sponsored becomes an unlawful non-citizen. It ends five years after they leave Australia. This means that the department might, up to five years after the person you have sponsored has left Australia, give you a letter requiring payment of the costs that the Commonwealth paid to locate and remove the person you sponsored prior to their departure from Australia. Secure an offer of a reasonable standard of accommodation Details If you sponsor someone to work for you as a volunteer without a salary or wages or sponsor someone to participate in a professional development program, you must secure an offer of a reasonable standard of accommodation in Australia for them and any family they bring with them. If the accommodation becomes unavailable, you must find alternative accommodation for them. A ‘reasonable standard of accommodation’ means that the accommodation must: meet all relevant state or territory and local government regulations regarding fire, health and safety offer 24-hour access provide meals or a self-catering kitchen be clean and well-maintained have a lounge area have adequate laundry facilities or a laundry service provide power for lighting, cooking and refrigeration have an adequate ratio of guests to bathroom facilities have uncrowded sleeping areas provide appropriate gender segregated areas and bathroom facilities allow adequate privacy and secure storage for personal items. This obligation starts on the day: your nomination of the sponsored person is approved, or the day the visa is granted (if the person you have sponsored does not already hold this visa when you nominate them or nomination was not required for that visa type). This obligation ends on the day (whichever is earliest): another sponsor has their nomination application for the same person approved the person you have sponsored is granted a further visa of a different type for which you sponsored them (unless that other visa is a bridging visa, criminal justice visa or enforcement visa) the person you have sponsored has left Australia and the visa (and any bridging visa) is no longer in effect. Monitoring of sponsors and visa holders Details You must comply with your obligations as a sponsor. We monitor your compliance with the sponsorship obligations and whether your visa holders are upholding their visa conditions. We monitor you while you are a sponsor and for up to five years after you cease being a sponsor. We do this routinely and in response to information provided to us, and in three main ways: exchanging information with other Commonwealth, state and territory government agencies, including the Department of Employment, the Fair Work Ombudsman, and the Australian Taxation Office. writing to you to ask for information in accordance with the obligation to provide records and information site visits, usually to the sponsored business premises, with or without notice Your compliance with the sponsorship obligations might be investigated by Immigration inspectors who have investigative powers under the Migration Act 1958 . Failure to cooperate with inspectors is a breach of the sponsorship obligations. Sanctions for not meeting your sponsor obligations Details If you do not meet your obligations, we could take one or more of the following actions: Administrative Details you could be barred from sponsoring more people for a specified time you could be barred from applying for approval to be a sponsor, in relation to this visa or another one all of your existing approvals as a sponsor could be cancelled. Enforceable undertaking You could be invited to enter into an enforceable undertaking. Enforceable undertakings require you to promise, in writing, to undertake to complete certain actions to demonstrate that the failures have been rectified and won’t happen again. Enforceable undertaking Details You could be invited to enter into an enforceable undertaking. Enforceable undertakings require you to promise, in writing, to undertake to complete certain actions to demonstrate that the failures have been rectified and won’t happen again. Civil Details we can issue an infringement notice of up to AUD10 200 for a body corporate and AUD2040 for an individual for each failure. we can apply to a court for a civil penalty order of up to AUD51 000 for a corporation and AUD10 200 for an individual for each failure. Other circumstances in which administrative action might be taken In addition, you could also have sanctions imposed if: The types of actions that could be taken depend on whether the sponsor is a standard business sponsor or has made a work agreement. If you have sponsored someone under a work agreement, we could suspend or terminate it in accordance with the clauses of the particular work agreement. you provide false or misleading information to us or the Migration Review Tribunal you no longer satisfy the criteria for approval as a sponsor or for variation of a term of that approval you have been found by a court or competent authority to have contravened a Commonwealth, state or territory law the person you have sponsored breaks a law relating to the licensing, registration or membership needed to work in the nominated position.

​This visa is closed to new applications.

# Domestic Worker (Temporary) Executive visa (subclass 427)

Domestic Worker (Temporary) Executive visa (subclass 427)
Page Content

​The Domestic Worker (Temporary) Executive visa (subclass 427) is closed to new applications. You cannot apply for this visa.

​The Domestic Worker (Temporary) Executive visa (subclass 427) is closed to new applications. You cannot apply for this visa.

You can use thevisa finderto search for an appropriate visa.

You can use the
visa finder
to search for an appropriate visa.

## Visa holders

Visa holders
Details

This information is for people who have already been granted a Domestic Worker (Temporary) Executive visa (subclass 427). It explains your rights and obligations.

This information is for people who have already been granted a Domestic Worker (Temporary) Executive visa (subclass 427). It explains your rights and obligations.

You can useVisa Entitlement Verification Online (VEVO)for free to check your visa details and entitlements.

You can use
Visa Entitlement Verification Online (VEVO)
for free to check your visa details and entitlements.

### How long your visa lasts

How long your visa lasts
Details

Your visa is usually valid for the period of the nominated position, with a maximum period of two years.

Your visa is usually valid for the period of the nominated position, with a maximum period of two years.

### What this visa lets you do

What this visa lets you do
Details

This visa lets you:

This visa lets you:
- work in Australia as a domestic worker in the household of an executive who is the holder of aBusiness (Long Stay) visa (subclass 457)
work in Australia as a domestic worker in the household of an executive who is the holder of a
Business (Long Stay) visa (subclass 457)
- stay in Australia for the period of the nominated position, with a maximum stay of two years
stay in Australia for the period of the nominated position, with a maximum stay of two years
- bring your family with you to Australia (they can work and study)
bring your family with you to Australia (they can work and study)
- leave and enter Australia as many times as you want while your visa is valid.
leave and enter Australia as many times as you want while your visa is valid.

### Your obligations

Your obligations
Details

You and your family must:

You and your family must:
- comply with all visa conditions and Australian laws.
comply with all visa conditions and Australian laws.
- maintain an adequate level of health insurance while you are in Australia.
maintain an adequate level of health insurance while you are in Australia.

#### Work in Australia

Work in Australia
Details

You must:

You must:
- not stop working for the employer who sponsored you for this visa
not stop working for the employer who sponsored you for this visa
- not engage in work or an activity that is inconsistent with your nominated position
not engage in work or an activity that is inconsistent with your nominated position
- not stay in Australia after the permanent departure of your employer
not stay in Australia after the permanent departure of your employer
- work only in the household of the employer who sponsored you for this visa.
work only in the household of the employer who sponsored you for this visa.

#### If you stop working for your sponsor

If you stop working for your sponsor
Details

If you stop working for your sponsor, you must:

If you stop working for your sponsor, you must:
- apply for a different visa
apply for a different visa
- leave Australia before your visa expires.
leave Australia before your visa expires.

#### Changing your sponsor

Changing your sponsor
Details

You will not be able to change employers while you are on your current visa.

You will not be able to change employers while you are on your current visa.

If you want to continue to work as a domestic worker for an overseas executive while you are in Australia, you can use thevisa finderto search for an appropriate visa.

If you want to continue to work as a domestic worker for an overseas executive while you are in Australia, you can use the
visa finder
to search for an appropriate visa.

#### Your family’s obligations

Your family’s obligations
Details

Your family cannot enter Australia before you. When your visa ends, your family must leave Australia with you.

Your family cannot enter Australia before you. When your visa ends, your family must leave Australia with you.

They must:

They must:
- intend to remain a member of your family unit
intend to remain a member of your family unit
- maintain adequate health insurance while they are in Australia.
maintain adequate health insurance while they are in Australia.

Your family can work or study while their visa is valid.

Your family can work or study while their visa is valid.

#### Tell us if things change

Tell us if things change
Details

Things you need to let us know about when you have this visa include:

Things you need to let us know about when you have this visa include:
- changes to your phone number, email, address or passport
changes to your phone number, email, address or passport
- changes to your relationship status
changes to your relationship status
- the birth of a child.
the birth of a child.

See how to let us know if there is achange in your situation.

See how to let us know if there is a
change in your situation
.

If you do not provide us with the details of any new passport issued to you, you could experience significant delays at the airport and may be denied permission to board your plane.

If you do not provide us with the details of any new passport issued to you, you could experience significant delays at the airport and may be denied permission to board your plane.

## Sponsors

Sponsors
Details

This information is for approved sponsors of people on a Domestic Worker (Temporary) Executive visa (subclass 427). You cannot apply to  sponsor applicants for this visa because it is no longer open to new applications.

This information is for approved sponsors of people on a Domestic Worker (Temporary) Executive visa (subclass 427). You cannot apply to  sponsor applicants for this visa because it is no longer open to new applications.

You can use thevisa finderto search for an appropriate visa.

You can use the
visa finder
to search for an appropriate visa.

You can useVisa Entitlement Verification Online (VEVO for Organisations)to check the visa details and entitlements of a person that you have sponsored.

You can use
Visa Entitlement Verification Online (VEVO for Organisations)
to check the visa details and entitlements of a person that you have sponsored.

### How long the sponsorship lasts

How long the sponsorship lasts

You can no longer use this sponsorship to sponsor domestic workers.

You can no longer use this sponsorship to sponsor domestic workers.

### Nominations

Nominations
Details

Each occupation, program or activity which you nominated will have its approval cease on the earliest of:

Each occupation, program or activity which you nominated will have its approval cease on the earliest of:
- the day on which we receive written notification of your withdrawal of the nomination
the day on which we receive written notification of your withdrawal of the nomination
- 12 months after the day on which the nomination is approved
12 months after the day on which the nomination is approved
- 3 months after the day on which your approval as a sponsor ceases if the nomination approval is given to you
3 months after the day on which your approval as a sponsor ceases if the nomination approval is given to you
- the day on which your approval as a sponsor is cancelled if the nomination approval is given to you
the day on which your approval as a sponsor is cancelled if the nomination approval is given to you
- the day on which the visa was granted on the basis of the nomination.
the day on which the visa was granted on the basis of the nomination.

### Sponsor obligations

Sponsor obligations
Details

You must be able to comply with following sponsorship obligations:

You must be able to comply with following sponsorship obligations:
- cooperate with inspectors
cooperate with inspectors
- tell us when certain events occur
tell us when certain events occur
- keep records
keep records
- provide records and information to the Minister
provide records and information to the Minister
- not recover from, transfer or charge certain costs to another person
not recover from, transfer or charge certain costs to another person
- pay costs to locate and remove an unlawful non-citizen
pay costs to locate and remove an unlawful non-citizen
- ensure the visa holder works in the nominated occupation, program or activity
ensure the visa holder works in the nominated occupation, program or activity
- pay travel costs to enable sponsored people to leave Australia
pay travel costs to enable sponsored people to leave Australia
- secure an offer of a reasonable standard of accommodation
secure an offer of a reasonable standard of accommodation

You are responsible for meeting all your obligations, even if you have someone else authorised to act on your behalf, including a migration agent.

You are responsible for meeting all your obligations, even if you have someone else authorised to act on your behalf, including a migration agent.

#### Cooperate with inspectors

Cooperate with inspectors
Details

You must cooperate with inspectors appointed under theMigration Act 1958(the Act) who are investigating whether:

You must cooperate with inspectors appointed under the
Migration Act 1958
(the Act) who are investigating whether:
- a sponsorship obligation is being, or has been, complied with
a sponsorship obligation is being, or has been, complied with
- you have hired an illegal worker
you have hired an illegal worker
- there are other circumstances in which we could take administrative action.
there are other circumstances in which we could take administrative action.

This obligation:

This obligation:
- starts on the day the sponsorship is approved or work agreement commences
starts on the day the sponsorship is approved or work agreement commences
- ends five years after the day the approved sponsorship ends  or work agreement ceases.
ends five years after the day the approved sponsorship ends  or work agreement ceases.

Cooperating with inspectors can include (but is not limited to):

Cooperating with inspectors can include (but is not limited to):
- providing access to premises
providing access to premises
- producing and providing documents within the requested timeframe
producing and providing documents within the requested timeframe
- not preventing  or attempting to prevent ,access to a person who has custody of, or access to, a record or documents
not preventing  or attempting to prevent ,access to a person who has custody of, or access to, a record or documents
- providing officers with access to interview any person on their premises.
providing officers with access to interview any person on their premises.

#### Keep records

Keep records
Details

You must keep records that show you have your complied with your obligations. All records must be in a reproducible format and some must be capable of verification by an independent person.

You must keep records that show you have your complied with your obligations. All records must be in a reproducible format and some must be capable of verification by an independent person.

You must keep a record of:

You must keep a record of:
- any notification that you were required to make to us
any notification that you were required to make to us
- the date on which you notified us, and how and where you made the notification.
the date on which you notified us, and how and where you made the notification.

This obligation starts on the day the sponsorship is approved.

This obligation starts on the day the sponsorship is approved.

This obligation ends two years after both of the following:

This obligation ends two years after both of the following:
- you are no longer an approved sponsor, and
you are no longer an approved sponsor, and
- you are no longer sponsoring anyone.
you are no longer sponsoring anyone.

You do not need to keep any records for more than five years.

You do not need to keep any records for more than five years.

#### Provide records and information to the Minister

Provide records and information to the Minister
Details

You must provide records or information, if they are requested by a departmental officer that goes to determining whether:

You must provide records or information, if they are requested by a departmental officer that goes to determining whether:
- a sponsorship obligation is being or has been complied with, and
a sponsorship obligation is being or has been complied with, and
- determining whether other circumstances, in which the Minister may take administrative action, exist or have existed,in the manner and timeframe requested by the department.
determining whether other circumstances, in which the Minister may take administrative action, exist or have existed,
in the manner and timeframe requested by the department.

We may ask you in writing to provide records or information which relate to your sponsorship obligations, and any other matters that relate to your sponsorship of visa holders. You must provide the records or information requested if it is a record or information that:

We may ask you in writing to provide records or information which relate to your sponsorship obligations, and any other matters that relate to your sponsorship of visa holders. You must provide the records or information requested if it is a record or information that:
- you are required to keep under Commonwealth, state or territory law
you are required to keep under Commonwealth, state or territory law
- you have an obligation to keep as a sponsor.
you have an obligation to keep as a sponsor.

This obligation starts to apply on the day the sponsorship is approved or work agreement commences.

This obligation starts to apply on the day the sponsorship is approved or work agreement commences.

This obligation ends two years after:

This obligation ends two years after:
- your sponsorship or work agreement ceases, and
your sponsorship or work agreement ceases, and
- you no longer have a sponsored visa holder.
you no longer have a sponsored visa holder.

#### Tell us when certain events occur

Tell us when certain events occur
Details

You must tell us in writing when certain events occur. Send the information by registered post or electronic mail to a specified address and within certain timeframes of the event occurring.

You must tell us in writing when certain events occur. Send the information by registered post or electronic mail to a specified address and within certain timeframes of the event occurring.

Events where a sponsor must provide information to us include:

Events where a sponsor must provide information to us include:
- the cessation, or expected cessation of a primary sponsored person's employment. If an expected cessation does not take place or the primary sponsored person will cease employment on a different date than previously notified, you must notify us of the continued employment or new cessation date; and
the cessation, or expected cessation of a primary sponsored person's employment. If an expected cessation does not take place or the primary sponsored person will cease employment on a different date than previously notified, you must notify us of the continued employment or new cessation date; and
- a change to the information in the sponsor's application for approval as a sponsor relating to the person's  address and contact details.
a change to the information in the sponsor's application for approval as a sponsor relating to the person's  address and contact details.

This obligation starts to apply on the day the standard business sponsorship is approved or the work agreement commences.

This obligation starts to apply on the day the standard business sponsorship is approved or the work agreement commences.

This obligation ends two years after:

This obligation ends two years after:
- your sponsorship or work agreement ends, and
your sponsorship or work agreement ends, and
- you are no longer sponsoring anyone.
you are no longer sponsoring anyone.

Where to send a notice of an event or change

Where to send a notice of an event or change

You must send details of these events by email or to one of our state or territory offices listed below.

You must send details of these events by email or to one of our state or territory offices listed below.

By email (preferred):sponsor.notifications@border.gov.au

By email (preferred):
sponsor.notifications@border.gov.au

#### Ensure that the visa holder participates in the nominated occupation, program or activity

Ensure that the visa holder participates in the nominated occupation, program or activity
Details

You must ensure that the person you have sponsored  participates only in the occupation, program or activity for which you nominated them. If you want to engage a visa holder for a different occupation, program or activity, you must lodge a new nomination application. This obligation starts on the day the person you have sponsored is granted a visa. If they already hold a visa when you nominate them, your obligation starts on the day the nomination is approved.

You must ensure that the person you have sponsored  participates only in the occupation, program or activity for which you nominated them. If you want to engage a visa holder for a different occupation, program or activity, you must lodge a new nomination application. This obligation starts on the day the person you have sponsored is granted a visa. If they already hold a visa when you nominate them, your obligation starts on the day the nomination is approved.

This obligation ends on the day (whichever is the earliest):

This obligation ends on the day (whichever is the earliest):
- the sponsored visa holder has a nomination approved for another approved sponsor
the sponsored visa holder has a nomination approved for another approved sponsor
- the sponsored visa holder is granted another  substantive visa of a different type for which you sponsored them (unless that other visa is a bridging visa, criminal justice visa or enforcement visa
the sponsored visa holder is granted another  substantive visa of a different type for which you sponsored them (unless that other visa is a bridging visa, criminal justice visa or enforcement visa
- the sponsored visa holder has left Australia and  the relevant visa (and any subsequent bridging visa) is no longer in effect.
the sponsored visa holder has left Australia and  the relevant visa (and any subsequent bridging visa) is no longer in effect.

#### Not recover, transfer or charge certain costs to another person

Not recover, transfer or charge certain costs to another person
Details

You must not take any action or seek to take any action that would result in the transfer or charging of costs (including migration agent costs) to another person, such as a sponsored visa holder or their sponsored family members this includes costs that relate to:

You must not take any action or seek to take any action that would result in the transfer or charging of costs (including migration agent costs) to another person, such as a sponsored visa holder or their sponsored family members this includes costs that relate to:
- the recruitment of  the person you sponsored
the recruitment of  the person you sponsored
- becoming or being a sponsor or former approved sponsor.
becoming or being a sponsor or former approved sponsor.

This obligation:

This obligation:
- starts on the day the sponsorship is approved or the work agreement commences
starts on the day the sponsorship is approved or the work agreement commences
- ends on the following two events:you cease to be an  approved sponsor or party to a work agreementyou no longer have a sponsored visa holder.
ends on the following two events:
- you cease to be an  approved sponsor or party to a work agreement
you cease to be an  approved sponsor or party to a work agreement
- you no longer have a sponsored visa holder.
you no longer have a sponsored visa holder.

Sponsors are also required to pay certain costs associated with becoming a sponsor and not pass these costs, in any form, onto another person. These include:

Sponsors are also required to pay certain costs associated with becoming a sponsor and not pass these costs, in any form, onto another person. These include:
- cost of sponsorship and nomination charges
cost of sponsorship and nomination charges
- migration agent costs associated with the lodgement of sponsorship and nomination applications
migration agent costs associated with the lodgement of sponsorship and nomination applications
- administrative costs and any sundry costs an employer incurs when they conduct recruitment exercises, including:recruitment agent feesmigration agent feesthe cost of job advertisingscreening of candidates, short listing, interviews and reference checkssalaries of recruitment or human resource staffthe cost of outsourcing background checks, police checks and psychological testing where they relate to an employer determining an applicant’s suitability for the positiontraining of new staffresponding to queries for prospective candidates, and advising unsuccessful applicantstravel costs for the sponsor to interview and/or meet the applicant either overseas or in Australia.
administrative costs and any sundry costs an employer incurs when they conduct recruitment exercises, including:
- recruitment agent fees

the cost of job advertising

screening of candidates, short listing, interviews and reference checks

training of new staff

responding to queries for prospective candidates, and advising unsuccessful applicants

#### Pay travel costs to enable domestic workers to enter and leave Australia

Pay travel costs to enable domestic workers to enter and leave Australia
Details

You must pay reasonable and necessary travel costs to enable the sponsored person and their sponsored family members to travel to and to leave Australia.

You must pay reasonable and necessary travel costs to enable the sponsored person and their sponsored family members to travel to and to leave Australia.

The costs will be considered reasonable and necessary if they include all of the following:

The costs will be considered reasonable and necessary if they include all of the following:
- the sponsored person’s travel to Australia
the sponsored person’s travel to Australia
- travel to the sponsored person’s place of residence in Australia from the place of arrival in Australia
travel to the sponsored person’s place of residence in Australia from the place of arrival in Australia
- travel from the sponsored person’s place of residence in Australia to the place of departure from Australia
travel from the sponsored person’s place of residence in Australia to the place of departure from Australia
- travel from Australia to the country from which the sponsored person came to Australia
travel from Australia to the country from which the sponsored person came to Australia
- are for economy class air travel or, where unavailable, a reasonable equivalent.
are for economy class air travel or, where unavailable, a reasonable equivalent.

This obligation starts on the day:

This obligation starts on the day:
- the visa is granted (if the person does not already hold a 427 visa or 401 visa in the domestic worker (executive stream)), or
the visa is granted (if the person does not already hold a 427 visa or 401 visa in the domestic worker (executive stream)), or
- your nomination is approved.
your nomination is approved.

This obligation ends on the day (whichever is the earliest):

This obligation ends on the day (whichever is the earliest):
- another sponsor has their nomination application for the same person approved
another sponsor has their nomination application for the same person approved
- the person you have sponsored is granted a further substantive visa of a different subclass to the one they last held
the person you have sponsored is granted a further substantive visa of a different subclass to the one they last held
- the person you have sponsored has left Australia and the relevant visa (and any subsequent bridging visa) is no longer in effect.
the person you have sponsored has left Australia and the relevant visa (and any subsequent bridging visa) is no longer in effect.

#### Pay costs to locate and remove an unlawful non-citizen

Pay costs to locate and remove an unlawful non-citizen
Details

In the event a primary sponsored person (or any of their sponsored family members) becomes an unlawful non-citizen, you may be required to pay the costs incurred by the Commonwealth in locating and/or removing the primary or secondary sponsored persons from Australia.

In the event a primary sponsored person (or any of their sponsored family members) becomes an unlawful non-citizen, you may be required to pay the costs incurred by the Commonwealth in locating and/or removing the primary or secondary sponsored persons from Australia.

You may be liable to pay the Commonwealth the difference between the actual costs incurred by the Commonwealth (up to a maximum of AUD10 000) less any amount which may have already been paid under the obligation to pay travel costs to enable sponsored persons to leave Australia (see ‘Obligation to pay travel costs’ above).

You may be liable to pay the Commonwealth the difference between the actual costs incurred by the Commonwealth (up to a maximum of AUD10 000) less any amount which may have already been paid under the obligation to pay travel costs to enable sponsored persons to leave Australia (see ‘Obligation to pay travel costs’ above).

This obligation starts on the day the person you sponsored becomes an unlawful non-citizen. It ends five years after they leave Australia.  This means that the department might, up to five years after the person you have sponsored has left Australia, give you a letter requiring payment of the costs that the Commonwealth paid to locate and remove the person you sponsored prior to their departure from Australia.

This obligation starts on the day the person you sponsored becomes an unlawful non-citizen. It ends five years after they leave Australia.  This means that the department might, up to five years after the person you have sponsored has left Australia, give you a letter requiring payment of the costs that the Commonwealth paid to locate and remove the person you sponsored prior to their departure from Australia.

#### Secure an offer of a reasonable standard of accommodation

Secure an offer of a reasonable standard of accommodation
Details

If you sponsor someone to work for you as a volunteer without a salary or wages or sponsor someone to participate in a professional development program, you must secure an offer of a reasonable standard of accommodation in Australia for them and any family they bring with them.

If you sponsor someone to work for you as a volunteer without a salary or wages or sponsor someone to participate in a professional development program, you must secure an offer of a reasonable standard of accommodation in Australia for them and any family they bring with them.

If the accommodation becomes unavailable, you must find alternative accommodation for them.

If the accommodation becomes unavailable, you must find alternative accommodation for them.

A ‘reasonable standard of accommodation’ means that the accommodation must:

A ‘reasonable standard of accommodation’ means that the accommodation must:
- meet all relevant state or territory and local government regulations regarding fire, health and safety
meet all relevant state or territory and local government regulations regarding fire, health and safety
- offer 24-hour access
offer 24-hour access
- provide meals or a self-catering kitchen
provide meals or a self-catering kitchen
- be clean and well-maintained
be clean and well-maintained
- have a lounge area
have a lounge area
- have adequate laundry facilities or a laundry service
have adequate laundry facilities or a laundry service
- provide power for lighting, cooking and refrigeration
provide power for lighting, cooking and refrigeration
- have an adequate ratio of guests to bathroom facilities
have an adequate ratio of guests to bathroom facilities
- have uncrowded sleeping areas
have uncrowded sleeping areas
- provide appropriate gender segregated areas and bathroom facilities
provide appropriate gender segregated areas and bathroom facilities
- allow adequate privacy and secure storage for personal items.
allow adequate privacy and secure storage for personal items.

This obligation starts on the day:

This obligation starts on the day:
- your nomination of the sponsored person is approved, or
your nomination of the sponsored person is approved, or
- the day the visa is granted (if the person you have sponsored does not already hold this visa when you nominate them or nomination was not required for that visa type).
the day the visa is granted (if the person you have sponsored does not already hold this visa when you nominate them or nomination was not required for that visa type).

This obligation ends on the day (whichever is earliest):

This obligation ends on the day (whichever is earliest):
- another sponsor has their nomination application for the same person approved
another sponsor has their nomination application for the same person approved
- the person you have sponsored is granted a further visa of a different type for which you sponsored them (unless that other visa is a bridging visa, criminal justice visa or enforcement visa)
the person you have sponsored is granted a further visa of a different type for which you sponsored them (unless that other visa is a bridging visa, criminal justice visa or enforcement visa)
- the person you have sponsored has left Australia and the visa (and any bridging visa) is no longer in effect.
the person you have sponsored has left Australia and the visa (and any bridging visa) is no longer in effect.

### Monitoring of sponsors and visa holders

Monitoring of sponsors and visa holders
Details

You must comply with your obligations as a sponsor. We monitor your compliance with the sponsorship obligations and whether your visa holders are upholding their visa conditions.

You must comply with your obligations as a sponsor. We monitor your compliance with the sponsorship obligations and whether your visa holders are upholding their visa conditions.

We monitor you while you are a sponsor and for up to five years after you cease being a sponsor. We do this routinely and in response to information provided to us, and in three main ways:

We monitor you while you are a sponsor and for up to five years after you cease being a sponsor. We do this routinely and in response to information provided to us, and in three main ways:
- exchanging information with other Commonwealth, state and territory government agencies, including the Department of Employment, the Fair Work Ombudsman, and the Australian Taxation Office.
exchanging information with other Commonwealth, state and territory government agencies, including the Department of Employment, the Fair Work Ombudsman, and the Australian Taxation Office.
- writing to you to ask for information in accordance with the obligation to provide records and information
writing to you to ask for information in accordance with the obligation to provide records and information
- site visits, usually to the sponsored business premises, with or without notice
site visits, usually to the sponsored business premises, with or without notice

Your compliance with the sponsorship obligations might be investigated by Immigration inspectors who have investigative powers under theMigration Act 1958. Failure to cooperate with inspectors is a breach of the sponsorship obligations.

Your compliance with the sponsorship obligations might be investigated by Immigration inspectors who have investigative powers under the
Migration Act 1958
. Failure to cooperate with inspectors is a breach of the sponsorship obligations.

### Sanctions for not meeting your sponsor obligations

Sanctions for not meeting your sponsor obligations
Details

If you do not meet your obligations, we could take one or more of the following actions:

If you do not meet your obligations, we could take one or more of the following actions:

#### Administrative

Administrative
Details
- you could be barred from sponsoring more people for a specified time
you could be barred from sponsoring more people for a specified time
- you could be barred from applying for approval to be a sponsor, in relation to this visa or another one
you could be barred from applying for approval to be a sponsor, in relation to this visa or another one
- all of your existing approvals as a sponsor could be cancelled.
all of your existing approvals as a sponsor could be cancelled.

Enforceable undertaking

Enforceable undertaking

You could be invited to enter into an enforceable undertaking.  Enforceable undertakings require you to promise, in writing, to undertake to complete certain actions to demonstrate that the failures have been rectified and won’t happen again.

You could be invited to enter into an enforceable undertaking.  Enforceable undertakings require you to promise, in writing, to undertake to complete certain actions to demonstrate that the failures have been rectified and won’t happen again.

#### Enforceable undertaking

Enforceable undertaking
Details

You could be invited to enter into an enforceable undertaking.  Enforceable undertakings require you to promise, in writing, to undertake to complete certain actions to demonstrate that the failures have been rectified and won’t happen again.

You could be invited to enter into an enforceable undertaking.  Enforceable undertakings require you to promise, in writing, to undertake to complete certain actions to demonstrate that the failures have been rectified and won’t happen again.

#### Civil

Civil
Details
- we can issue an infringement notice of up to AUD10 200 for a body corporate and AUD2040 for an individual for each failure.
we can issue an infringement notice of up to AUD10 200 for a body corporate and AUD2040 for an individual for each failure.
- we can apply to a court for a civil penalty order of up to AUD51 000 for a corporation and AUD10 200 for an individual for each failure.
we can apply to a court for a civil penalty order of up to AUD51 000 for a corporation and AUD10 200 for an individual for each failure.

Other circumstances in which administrative action might be taken

Other circumstances in which administrative action might be taken

In addition, you could also have sanctions imposed if:

In addition, you could also have sanctions imposed if:

The types of actions that could be taken depend on whether the sponsor is a standard business sponsor or has made  a work agreement.

The types of actions that could be taken depend on whether the sponsor is a standard business sponsor or has made  a work agreement.

If you have sponsored someone under a work  agreement, we could suspend or terminate it in accordance with the clauses of the particular work  agreement.

If you have sponsored someone under a work  agreement, we could suspend or terminate it in accordance with the clauses of the particular work  agreement.
- you provide false or misleading information to us or the Migration Review Tribunal
you provide false or misleading information to us or the Migration Review Tribunal
- you no longer satisfy the criteria for approval as a sponsor or for variation of a term of that approval
you no longer satisfy the criteria for approval as a sponsor or for variation of a term of that approval
- you have been found by a court or competent authority to have contravened a Commonwealth, state or territory law
you have been found by a court or competent authority to have contravened a Commonwealth, state or territory law
- the person you have sponsored breaks a law relating to the licensing, registration or membership needed to work in the nominated position.
the person you have sponsored breaks a law relating to the licensing, registration or membership needed to work in the nominated position.
